content.text:
# 1995 Country Music Association Awards

The 1995 Country Music Association Awards, 29th Ceremony, was held on October 4, 1995 at the Grand Ole Opry House, Nashville, Tennessee, and was hosted by CMA Award Winner, Vince Gill.
Winners and Nominees
Winner are in Bold.
{| class="wikitable"
! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year
! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year
|-
| valign="top" |
* Alan Jackson
** Brooks & Dunn
** Garth Brooks
** Reba McEntire
** Vince Gill
| valign="top" |
* 'When Fallen Angels Fly — Patty Loveless'
** John Michael Montgomery — John Michael Montgomery
** Lead On — George Strait
** When Love Finds You — Vince Gill
** Who Am I — Alan Jackson
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Male Vocalist of the Year
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year
|-
| valign="top" |
* Vince Gill
** John Berry
** Alan Jackson
** John Michael Montgomery
** George Strait
| valign="top" |
* Alison Krauss
** Mary Chapin Carpenter
** Patty Loveless
** Reba McEntire
** Pam Tillis
|-

** "Any Man Of Mine" — Shania Twain

| valign="top" |
*"Independence Day" — Gretchen Peters
**"Don't Take The Girl" — Craig Martin and Larry Johnson
**"Gone Country" — Bob McDill
**"How Can I Help You Say Goodbye"— Karen Taylor—Good and Burton Banks Collins
**"Thinkin' Problem" — David Ball, Allen Shamblin, and Stuart Ziff
|-
! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Horizon Award

** "When Love Finds You" — Vince Gill
